Articles.Content:
So I went with Tarsier tech. space telescope and I love it! I hastily crammed together this lame JWST base for it so I could get to orbit and play with it and I happened to catch a spectacular eclipse of Eve by Kerbin from Kerbocentric orbit.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=267024537

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=267024732

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=267024844

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=267025027

Also ran..

The Solar limb. I wonder if that's atmosphere or this " low above the sun" I keep hearing about?

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=267023890

Eeloo from Kerbocentric orbit.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=267024364

Highly recommend.

Edited June 4, 2014 by Aethon

very nice!

put it in high sun orbit and get more cool pics!

Edited June 4, 2014 by nli2work
Not to burst ypur bubble to badly. But, it is Eve is Eclipsing Kerbin not Kerbin Eclipsing Eve on your steam shots. Just a tad bit misleading there other then that. Great chance shots.
something like this should be stock. throw in a few science points
What? You mean Pink Floyd lied to us? Is not the sun eclipsed by the moo,oo,oo,oon?
I wanted that but the mod crashed my game. Weird.

I wanted that but the mod crashed my game. Weird.

Try Cateye. It requires Hullcam VDS which has it's own telescopes as well. Cateye provides more game play.

Yeah I looked at that. I wish ( and don't wish ) the game was complete so I could decide whether to mod v1.0 or not, and what mods to use or not, and not hafta worry about falling in love with a mod and having it loose support and functionality in the next update.

Ok, My design skills, while improving still leave a lot to be desired, and I had a hell of a time in the VAB getting the wings to click on further back. Five hours later I decided to modify my first craft. I think it retains a JWSTy feel while looking pretty kerbal.

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=268848668

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=268848938

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=268849069

http://steamcommunity.com/sharedfiles/filedetails/?id=268849182

The OOGLE Space Telescope ( [O]n [O]rbit [G]reat [L]ooking [E]xperiment. Also the name of a famous Kerbal astronomer, Sir Oogley Kerman. ), on its way to HKO for some quick SCIENCE, then off to high solar orbit, for stability purposes.

Edited June 8, 2014 by Aethon
